intro: Hoarea rosea, commonly known as the roseum plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Hoarea rosea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
